subject: Re: [junit] How to test protected and private methods/ fields?

messageBody:
At 10:55 AM 23/05/01, you wrote:


>Jens Andersen wrote:
>
> > Hi all,
> >
> > First of all I have to mention that I'm pretty novice when it comes to use
> > JUnit for writing unittests. But I have a question which I hope some of you
> > can help me with - it's regarding testing private/protected methods and how
> > to organize my test package.
> >
> > First the package. I have read to articles regarding test ("Junit best
> > practices" from JavaWorld and "Incremental development with Ant and JUnit"
> > from developerWorks). In the JBT article Andy Schneider advice you to keep
> > tests in the same location as the source code. And in the Incremental...
> > article Malcolm Davis advice you to make a separate package. Which approach
> > is the best to use?
> >
>
>it is better to make separate package. when we can identify as two separate
>components like source code and test code it is better to keep them as two
>different components from configuration management point of view.



On the other hand...
I have the test classes in the same package as the classes to test, and
then use delete/fileset/include in ant when packaging.

e.g.:
<target name="remove_tests">
<delete>
<fileset dir="${build}">
<include name="**/*Test*.class"/>
</fileset>
</delete>
</target>

This means I can test all but private methods.
(Of course, if you have any classes that you want to keep that include
"Test" in their names this won't work...)


HTH,
Jim
